## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 270, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.

<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
In Molimba, the heights, in cm, of adult males are normally distributed with mean \(176\mathrm{cm}\) and standard deviation \(4.8\mathrm{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 117, 144, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 918, 152]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that a randomly chosen adult male in Molimba has a height greater than \(170 \mathrm{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 440, 902, 460]]<|/det|>
60% of adult males in Molimba have a height between \(170 \mathrm{cm}\) and \(k \mathrm{cm}\), where \(k\) is greater than 170.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 473, 146, 492]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 473, 675, 492]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(k\), giving your answer correct to 1 decimal place.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 473, 920, 492]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 70, 920, 106]]<|/det|> On a certain day, the heights of 150 sunflower plants grown by children at a local school are measured, correct to the nearest cm. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 198, 144, 216]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 198, 601, 217]]<|/det|> Draw a cumulative frequency graph to illustrate the data. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 198, 920, 216]]<|/det|> [4] <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[175, 242, 816, 808]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 852, 146, 870]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 851, 816, 870]]<|/det|> Use your graph to estimate the 30th percentile of the heights of the sunflower plants. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 851, 920, 870]]<|/det|> [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Calculate estimates for the mean and the standard deviation of the heights of the 150 sunflower plants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 85, 920, 103]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 702, 88]]<|/det|>
Keifa chooses chocolates one at a time at random from the production line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 146, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that the second chocolate chosen is the first one wrapped in gold foil given that the fifth chocolate chosen is the first unwrapped chocolate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 69, 94, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 69, 143, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 69, 811, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the number of different arrangements of the 9 letters in the word HAPPINESS. [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 351, 186, 369]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 351, 917, 384]]<|/det|>
Find the number of different arrangements of the 9 letters in the word HAPPINESS in which the first and last letters are not the same as each other. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 71, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
Find the number of different arrangements of the 9 letters in the word HAPPINESS in which the two Ps are together and there are exactly two letters between the two Ss. [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 490, 866, 509]]<|/det|>
The 9 letters in the word HAPPINESS are divided at random into a group of 5 and a group of 4.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 521, 146, 539]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 520, 813, 539]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that both Ps are in one group and both Ss are in the other group. [3]
